sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: XFS contains xfs_growfs, xfs_admin, xfs_freeze, xfs_mkfile, xfs_check, xfs_bmap, xfs_rtcp, xfs_repair, xfs_db, xfs_logprint, xfs_ncheck, mkfs.xfs and fsck.xfs.

sect3.title: xfs_admin
sect3.para: xfs_admin changes the parameters of an XFS filesystem.

sect3.title: xfs_freeze
sect3.para: xfs_freeze suspends access to an XFS filesystem.

sect3.title: xfs_mkfile
sect3.para: xfs_mkfile creates an XFS file, padded with zeroes by default.

sect3.title: xfs_bmap
sect3.para: xfs_bmap prints block mapping for an XFS file.

sect3.title: xfs_rtcp
sect3.para: xfs_rtcp copies a file to the real-time partition on an XFS filesystem.

sect3.title: xfs_repair
sect3.para: xfs_repair repairs corrupt or damaged XFS filesystems.

sect3.title: xfs_db
sect3.para: xfs_db is used to debug an XFS filesystem.

sect3.title: xfs_logprint
sect3.para: xfs_logprint prints the log of an XFS filesystem.

sect3.title: xfs_ncheck
sect3.para: xfs_ncheck generates pathnames from inode numbers for an XFS filesystem.

sect3.title: fsck.xfs
sect3.para: fsck.xfs simply exits with a zero status, since XFS partitions are checked at mount time.
